Subject: Geomorphology
data: 1 Residual hill in the desert region is known as : A Inlier B Inselberg C Playa D Pediment Answer: Option [B]

2 Which of the following represents a process of chemical weathering ? A Thermal expansion and contraction B Mass exfoliation C Hydration and Hydrolysis D Frost action and crystal growth Answer: Option [C]
3 The most ideal conditions for the chemical weathering are found in : A cold and dry regions B cold and humid regions C hot and dry regions D hot and humid regions Answer: Option [D]
4 The instrument used for recording earthquake waves is : A barograph B hydrograph C pantograph D seismograph Answer: Option [D]
5 When the wind is deflected due to the rotation of the Earth, it is called as : A geostrophic wind B polar wind C westerlies D trade winds Answer: Option [A]
6 The Sea breeze blows during : A day from land to sea B day from sea to land C right from land to sea D right from sea to land Answer: Option [B]
7 Very strong and cold icy winds that blow in the Polar regions are called : A typhoons B tornadoes C blizzards D polar winds Answer: Option [C]
8 Warm dry winds blowing down the east slopes of Rockies are known as : A Mistral B Norwesters C Foehn D Chinook Answer: Option [D]
9 The hot dry local winds that blow on the eastern side of the Alps Mountain are known as : A Chinook B Foehn C Khamsin D Sirocco Answer: Option [B]
10 Which of the following is the highest Plateau in the world ? A Colorado Plateau B Pamir Plateau C Patagonia Plateau D Potwar Plateau Answer: Option [B]
11 The reason behind the drifting away of continents is : A volcanic eruptions B tectonic activities C folding and faulting of rocks D All of the above Answer: Option [B]
12 What kind of soils formed by wind dust in and around hot deserts ? A Silty soil B Loamy soil C Sandy soil D loess soil Answer: Option [D]
13 The largest temperate desert of the world is : A Iranian desert B Patagonian desert C Taklamakan desert D Turkmen desert Answer: Option [B]
14 Which of the following rocks is transformed into marble ? A Granite B Kimberlite C Limestone D Norite Answer: Option [C]
15 The example of acid igneous rocks is : A Granite B Dolerite C Gabbro D Pumice Answer: Option [A]
16 Which form of coal is usually used in Thermal Power Plants ? A Anthracite B Lignite C Bituminous D Peat Answer: Option [C]
17 What is the scale of earthquake intensity ? A Beaufort scale B Seismic scale C Secant scale D None of these Answer: Option [B]
18 The removal of curved plates of rocks layer by layer due to mechanical weathering is called : A block disintegration B deflation C exfoliation D partitioning Answer: Option [C]
19 Mid-ocean ridge is formed due to the plate movement which is called : A Convergent movement B Divergent movement C Transform fault movement D Lateral slipping plate movement Answer: Option [B]

20 What causes an Earthquake ? A Frequent occurrence of cyclones B Movement of plates of earth, which float on the hot volcanic mantle below the Earth's surface C Underground nuclear explosions D Drilling of crude oil Answer: Option [B]
21 Which of the following processes are involved in formation of sedimentary rocks ? A Mountain building B Lithification C Fractional crystallization D None of these Answer: Option [B]

22 Which of the following is related to Shield volcano formation ? A Explosive lava eruptions B Repeated lava flows C Loose, grainy cinders D Ejection of a wide range of pyroclastic materials Answer: Option [B]
23 Which type of volcanic eruption is the most explosive ? A Strombolian Eruption B Vulcanian Eruption C Plinian Eruption D Surtseyan Eruption Answer: Option [C]
24 What kind of volcanic eruption is least explosive ? A Hawaiian Eruption B Strombolian Eruption C Lava Domes D Surtseyan Eruption Answer: Option [A]
25 What is the longest mountain range in the world ? A Andes B Coast mountain C Himalayas D Western Ghats Answer: Option [A]
26 The study of movement inside Earth's crust is called : A Geology B Geodesy C Seismology D Plate tectonics Answer: Option [C]
27 Which of the following is the source of soil material ? A Sedimentary rocks B Metamorphic rocks C Igneous rocks D Biological action Answer: Option [B]
28 Which of the following things come out of a volcano eruption ? A solid, gas, liquid B only liquid C gas and solid D liquid and gas Answer: Option [A]
29 The coal and petroleum are found in which type of rocks ? A Latite rock B Sedimentary rocks C Granite rocks D Pyroxenite rocks Answer: Option [B]
30 The gold and copper are mostly found in which type of rocks ? A Old igneous B New sedimentary C New metamorphic D Old metamorphic Answer: Option [A]
31 Rift valley is formed due to A Warping B Faulting C Folding D All of the above Answer: Option [B]
32 Exogenic geological process includes A Erosion B Mass wasting C Weathering D All of the above Answer: Option [D]
33 The work of river in middle course is mainly A Erosion B Deposition C Transportation D Both (B) and (C) Answer: Option [A]
34 Mass of the earth is estimated to be A 5.880 x 1021 tons B 5.760 x 1019 tons C 5.800 x 1025 tons D 5.880 x 1020 tons Answer: Option [A]
35 Prime Meridian passes through A Greenwich B New York C Tokyo D UK Answer: Option [A]
36 Himalayas is an example of A Fold mountains B Fault mountains C Rift valley D All of the above Answer: Option [A]
37 A lagoon is formed by A Wind deposition B Wind erosion C Wave erosion D Wave deposition Answer: Option [C]
38 Islands are formed by A Glaciation B Wave action C Volcanic activity D River action Answer: Option [B]
39 Hanging valleys are very common in A Karst regions B Dry area C Plain area D Snow covered area Answer: Option [D]
40 A fast flowing river forms A Col B Deltas C Flood-plains D Sink-holes Answer: Option [C]
41 Horns are made by A Wind erosion B River erosion C Glacial deposition D Glacial erosion Answer: Option [D]
42 Ox-bow lakes are formed due to A Flooding B Wave erosion C Intense meandering D None of these Answer: Option [C]
43 The shape of the river valley is generally like A V B U C Both (A) and (B) D None of them Answer: Option [A]
44 Sedimentary rocks are also called A Stratified rocks B Aqueous rocks C Both (A) and (B) D None of these Answer: Option [A]
45 ‘U’ shaped valley is formed by A Glacier B A river in plains C A river in mountainous areas D All of the above Answer: Option [A]
46 Which of the following constituents of the Pelagic sediment is maximum in area wise distribution ? A Red clay B Diatom C Radiolarian ooze D None of the above Answer: Option [A]

47 Continental drift refers to A The vertical movement of the continents on a small scale B The vertical movement of the continents on a vast scale C The horizontal movement of the continents on a small scale D The horizontal movement of the continents on a vast scale Answer: Option [D]
48 Which of the following waves are responsible for most of the destructive force of earthquake ? A R-wave B S-wave C L-wave D All of the above Answer: Option [C]
49 Lave cones are A Fold mountains B Fault mountains C Mountains of accumulation D Relict mountains Answer: Option [C]
50 Processes that shape the earth’s surface include A Hypogene processes B Geomorphic processes C Tetra-tonsorial processes D None of the above Answer: Option [B]
51 ........ is one of the biggest deltas of the world A Mississippi delta B Nile delta C Ganga-Brahmaputra delta D Amazon delta Answer: Option [C]

52 International date line is the line where A Local time is advanced by one hour B The date changes by exactly one day when it is crossed C From all other meridians radiate eastward and westward up to 1800 D None of the above Answer: The date changes by exactly one day when it is crossed
53 The rocks of the Paleozoic Era are known as A Shale B Graphite C Granite D Light limestone Answer: Option [A]
54 Incised meanders occur in A Karst areas B Riverine areas C Glaciated regions D Mountain areas Answer: Option [B]
55 Drumlins are associated with A Glacial deposition B River deposition C Glacial erosion D River erosion Answer: Option [A]
56 The hypothesis of Plate-tectonics assumes that the earth is composed of A 15 lithospheric plates B 20 lithospheric plates C 25 lithospheric plates D 30 lithospheric plates Answer: Option [B]
57 ‘Weathering’ is A The alternate heating and cooling of rocks B The freezing of water in creaks in rocks C The break-up of rocks exposed at the surface D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
58 The stream which gets divided into a network of channels forming bars of send and bland is known as A Plunge pool B Braided stream C Meander D Ox-bone shape cabe Answer: Option [B]
59 Which of the following is a post volcanic activity ? A Lava ejection B Earthquakes C Thermal spring formation D All of these Answer: Option [A]
60 Granite is a typical example of A Metamorphic rocks B Sedimentary rocks C Igneous rocks D Both (A) and (B) Answer: Option [C]
61 Phenomenon of river capture is associated with A Head ward erosion by river B Lateral erosion by river C Erosion in a head ward direction by glacier D Lateral erosion by glacier Answer: Option [A]
62 Eskers occur in A River valleys B Tunnels in karst areas C Tunnels under the glaciers D Both (B) and (C) Answer: Option [C]
63 The hanging masses of limestone in a cavern from the roof are called A Stalagmites B Grip stones C Stalactites D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
64 River erosion is responsible for the formation of A Sink-holes B Kames C Pot-holes D Swallow-holes Answer: Option [C]
65 Underground water’s action is responsible for the creation of A Giant stairways B U-shaped valley C Cementation D Avalanches Answer: Option [C]
66 The earth has an average surface temperature of A 200C B 80C C 150C D 100C Answer: Option [C]
67 Demoiselles are a creation of A Wave action B Glacial deposition C Wind erosion D Glacial action Answer: Option [C]
68 Stone lattice is formed due to A Equal erosion by wind B Equal erosion by wave C Equal erosion by water D Equal erosion by glacier Answer: Option [A]
69 Chasms are formed in A Rocks without strata B Rocks with inclined strata C Rock with horizontal strata D Rocks with vertical strata Answer: Option [D]
70 A stretch of land surrounded by water on all sides is known as A A strait B An island C A peninsula D None of these Answer: Option [B]
71 The basic difference between oceanic and continental crust is that of A Density B Uniformity C Structure D None of the above Answer: Option [D]
72 Which of the following rocks have gold and iron contents generally ? A Shale B Granite C Basalt D All of the above Answer: Option [C]
73 Pediplanation is process associated with A Glaciation B Wave action C Wind action D Volcanic action Answer: Option [B]
74 Sills are formed by A Glaciation B Intrusive volcanicity C Wave action D Wind action Answer: Option [B]
75 Arches are an advanced form of A Horns B Caves C Esker D Cols Answer: Option [B]
76 Playas are located in A Deltas B Low lying areas in the desert C Raised areas in the deserts D None of the above Answer: Option [B]
77 Needles are associated with the process of A Attrition B Solution C Deposition D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
78 Blowouts are the formation of A Wind erosion B Wind deposition C River deposition D River erosion Answer: Option [A]
79 Glacial deposition is responsible for the formation of A Kames B Columns C Aretes D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
80 Sink-holes and dolines are a formation of A Glacial erosion B Wind erosion C Riverine erosion D Erosion in karst region Answer: Option [D]
81 Stacks are formed by A Wind deposition B Glacial erosion C Wind erosion D Wave erosion Answer: Option [D]
82 The longitudinal deposits in the tunnel under a glacier are called A Drumlins B Eskers C Moraines D All of the above Answer: Option [B]
83 Drip-stones occur in A Cavern B Cirque C Blind-valley D Rift valley Answer: Option [A]
84 Glacial erosion is responsible for the formation of A Dry valley B Saddles C Sink holes D V shaped valley Answer: Option [B]

85 ‘Knock – and – lochan’ topography A is associated with melt water erosion B is found in the arid region C is associated with river erosion D is associated with glaciation in lowland area Answer: Option [D]
86 Giant stairways are formed by A River deposits B River piracy C Glacial deposits D Glacial erosion Answer: Option [D]
87 Two glaciers cutting head ward from opposite directions form a A Col B Cirque C Esker D Dolines Answer: Option [A]
88 Kames are a feature of A Coastal areas B Desert areas C Riverine areas D Glaciated topography Answer: Option [D]
89 Structural benches are formed due to A Equal erosion B Differential erosion on the banks C Differential erosion along the valley bottom D Both (A) and (B) Answer: Option [C]
90 Pot-holes are a creation of A Wind erosion B Glacial erosion C River erosion D Abrasion on the floor of the river valley Answer: Option [C]
91 The erosional topographical features are formed through A Exogenic processes B Endogenic processes C Hypogene processes D None of them Answer: Option [A]
92 Which out of the following is also known as the Great Ice Age ? A Tertiary Era B Mesozoic Era C Quaternary Era D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
93 Who described the three layers of the earth as ‘top-layer’, ‘middle-layer’ and ‘lower-layer’ ? A Jeffrey B Holmes C Moho D Dally Answer: Option [A]
94 Sandstone is metamorphosed into A Quartzite B Schist C Graphite D None of these Answer: Option [A]
95 The characteristic features of limestone topography are A Caverns B Dry and blind valleys C Sink holes and shallow holes D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
96 ‘Cirques’ are land forms of A First order B Second order C Third order D Fourth order Answer: Option [B]
97 The ‘convection current hypothesis’ is related to A Volcano B Earthquake C Origin of earth D Both (A) and (B) Answer: Option [C]
98 Running water is the chief agent of the formation of A Sedimentary rocks B Metamorphic rocks C Igneous rocks D None of the above Answer: Option [A]

99 In Palaeozoic Era some movements occurred. Find out the correct sequence. A Taconian, Armonican, Caledonian, Varicon B Armonican, Caledonian, Taconian, Varicon C Varicon, Taconian, Caledonian, Armonican D Taconian, Caledonian, Armonican, Varicon Answer: Option [D]
100 ‘Step Fault’ occurs when A It is another name of recumbent fault B Actually it occurs in fold mountains C The crust is broken into several parallel D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
101 The top of the cone of a volcanic mountain has a depression known as the A Sill B Water C Lopolith D Crater Answer: Option [D]
102 The Earth turns through 3600 in 24 hrs. Each 150 longitude represents A 15 minutes B Half an hour C One hour D 1 hour 15 minutes Answer: Option [C]
103 Which instrument is used to keep the correct Greenwich Mean Time ? A Clinometer B Barometer C Chronometer D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
104 Grooving are formed due to A Erosion by glacier B Deposition by river C Erosion by underground water D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
105 Lapies are formed by A Erosion by wind B Erosion by glacier C Erosion by river D Erosion in limestone areas Answer: Option [D]
106 The chief weathering processes are A Hydration B Hydrolysis and solution C Hydrolysis and oxidation D All of the above Answer: Option [C]

107 Orogenic movements are responsible for A The formation of great continents B The formation of fault mountains C The formation of great fold mountain ranges of the world D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
108 How many for each degree of longitude does the local time of any place vary from the Greenwich Time ? A Four minutes B Six minutes C Eight minutes D Ten minutes Answer: Option [A]

109 Plutonic rocks are A Changed rocks under great heat and pressure B Non-crystalline and often contain fossils of animals and plants C The igneous rocks formed at some depth in the earth’s crust D Precipitated chemically from solutions of one kind or another Answer: Option [C]
110 Which out of the following is regarded as the chief rock types of the Pre-Cambrian Era ? A Shale B Light limestone C Granite and Gneiss D Both (A) and (B) Answer: Option [C]

111 The characteristics of the Hawaiian type volcano is A Periodic eruption with a little explosive activity. B Silent effusion of lava without any explosive activity. C Silent effusion of lava with some explosive. D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
112 Tier is A Cap-shaped structure B Weathered blocks of rocks in sharp edged shape C Weathered block of rocks in round edged shape D Both (B) and (C) Answer: Option [C]
113 ‘Graben’ is A A dropped block B An uplifted block C A geosyncline D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
114 The distance between the earth and the sun is greatest during A Aphelion B Perihelion C Winter solstice D Summer solstice Answer: Option [A]

115 What is the basis of the formation of sedimentary rocks ? A Formed by the agent of fire B Formed by the agencies of water, wind, and ice. C Formed by the agent of pressure. D Formed by the agencies of heat, water and pressure. Answer: Option [B]
116 A peneplain is formed due to A Alluvial erosion B Glacial erosion C Wind erosion and deposition D River erosion and deposition. Answer: Option [D]
117 Islands are formed A in Uvalas B in caverns C in a river valley D near the snout of a glacier Answer: Option [C]
118 Outwash plains are formed by A Wind B Glaciers C Rivers D All of the above Answer: Option [B]
119 Nappes are the formed due to A Folding B Faulting C Warping D All of the above Answer: Option [A]
120 Inselbergs are formed in A Pediplains B Deltas C Flood plains D Desert area Answer: Option [A]
121 Barchans are formed due to A River erosion B Wind erosion C Wind deposition D Glacial erosion Answer: Option [C]
122 Sea caves are a creation of A Wind deposition B Glacial erosion C Wave erosion D Wave deposition Answer: Option [C]
123 A lava shield is formed by A Wind action B Intrusive volcanicity C Extrusive volcanicity D None of the above Answer: Option [C]
124 Metamorphic rocks are formed under A High pressure and high temperature B Low pressure and low temperature C High pressure and low temperature D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
125 The Dead Sea is located in a A Rift valley B Canyon C Intermontane plateau D Intermontane plain Answer: Option [A]
126 Which strait separates the Red Sea from the Indian Ocean ? A Malacca Strait B Gulf Strait C Bab el-Mandeb Strait D None of these Answer: Option [C]
127 Bajada is the formation of A Erosion B Deposition C Transportation D All of the above Answer: Option [A]
128 Dreikanter is a creation of A Wave erosion B Glacial erosion C Wind erosion D Wind deposition Answer: Option [C]
129 Zeugens are a creation of A Wind erosion B Wave erosion C Glacial erosion D River erosion Answer: Option [A]
130 Yardang are a creation of A River erosion B Wave erosion C Glacial erosion D Wind erosion Answer: Option [D]
131 A monadnock is A A low area in a riverine plain B A low area in a glacial plain C A raised portion in a riverine plain D None of these Answer: Option [C]
132 Basalt is a typical example of A Plutonic rocks B Metamorphic rocks C Sedimentary rocks D Igneous rocks Answer: Option [D]
133 When the earth resolves round the sun it spins on an elliptical orbit at a speed of A 18.9 miles/second B 18.8 miles/second C 18.7 miles/second D 18.6 miles/second Answer: Option [A]
134 Who described the three layers of the earth as ‘sial’, ‘sima’, and ‘nife’ ? A Dally B Gracht C Holmes D None of the above Answer: Option [B]
135 Autumn equinox occurs in A March 21 B September 22 C December 22 D June 21 Answer: Option [B]
136 The Gaseous Mass Theory of the origin of earth was given by A E. Kant B Roche C Lockyer D Laplace Answer: Option [A]
137 Conrad Discontinuity is found A Between crust and mantle B Between outer and inner core C Between Sial and Sima D Between upper mantle and lower mantle Answer: Option [C]
138 The ‘hydraulic slope theory’ is given by A Darwin B Penck C R. E. Horton D Lockyer Answer: Option [C]
139 ‘Escarpment’ appears A When a block moves upward B When a block moves vertically C When a block slips down along the fault plane D None of the above Answer: Option [A]
140 ‘Rock benches’ are associated with A Cross profile of river B Long profile of river C Fold mountains D Fault mountains Answer: Option [B]
141 Graphite is a typical example of A Sedimentary rocks B Metamorphic rocks C Plutonic rocks D Igneous rocks Answer: Option [D]
142 ‘Exfoliation’ is common in A Mountains B Deserts C Coastal areas D Plain region Answer: Option [B]
143 Nappes, a type of mountain, is formed due to A Fault B Folds C Warping D None of these Answer: Option [A]
144 ‘Nivation’ is A Accumulation of snow B Erosion by wind C Erosion by snow D Melting of snow Answer: Option [C]
145 Ozone is found in A Mesosphere B Ozonosphere C Troposphere D Stratosphere Answer: Option [D]
